SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class GameMaster

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.GameMaster
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GameMaster extends Object implements Serializable
The GameMaster class represents the main game logic in the application. It manages the game state, player turns, card decks, and scoring. It also handles the placement of cards and the drawing of cards from the deck or table. The GameMaster interacts with the Lobby to manage the players and with the Deck to manage the cards. It also uses various helper methods to calculate scores, check if a card can be placed, and find cards in the game graph. The GameMaster class throws various exceptions to handle invalid game actions.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GameMaster

      public GameMaster(Lobby lobby, String jsonResourceCardFileName, String jsonGoldCardFileName, String jsonObjectiveCardFileName, String jsonObjectiveStartFileName) throws IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      The general functionalities of the game representing the peer point of the Model, the object is going to speak with the Controller
      Parameters:
      lobby - Lobby of user that are going to play
      jsonResourceCardFileName - json file name to create the resource deck
      jsonGoldCardFileName - json file name to create the gold deck
      jsonObjectiveCardFileName - json file name to create the objective deck
      jsonObjectiveStartFileName - json file name to create the starting deck
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file is not found or can't be read
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if the file is not a valid JSON file

  • Method Details

    • tryLoadingGameMaster

      public static GameMaster tryLoadingGameMaster(String path) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Creates a new instance from a saved GameMaster on file.
      Parameters:
      path - path of the file to load.
      Returns:
      the loaded GameMaster.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file is not found or can't be read.
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class is not found.

    • cancelFile

      public static void cancelFile(String savePath)
      This method is used to delete a file from the file system. It takes as input the path of the file to be deleted. If the file exists and is successfully deleted, no exception is thrown. If the file does not exist or cannot be deleted due to a system error, no exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      savePath - A string representing the path of the file to be deleted.

    • placeRootCard

      public int placeRootCard(String namePlayer, boolean side) throws NoTurnException, WrongGamePhaseException, NoNameException
      First turn cycle in which every player decides in which side place its StartingCard
      Parameters:
      namePlayer - player who sent the request
      side - which side the StartingCard has been want placed
      Returns:
      the id of the card placed
      Throws:
      NoTurnException - if the player is not the current player
      WrongGamePhaseException - if the game is not in the right phase
      NoNameException - if the player name is not found

    • chooseObjectiveCard

      public void chooseObjectiveCard(String namePlayer, int whichCard) throws NoTurnException, WrongGamePhaseException, NoNameException
      Second turn cycle in which every player decides which of the two ObjectiveCard pick
      Parameters:
      namePlayer - player who sent the request
      whichCard - which of the two ObjectiveCard wants to be used (0, 1)
      Throws:
      NoTurnException - if the player is not the current player
      WrongGamePhaseException - if the game is not in the right phase
      NoNameException - if the player name is not found

    • placeCard

      public int placeCard(String namePlayer, int index, Point position, boolean side) throws NoTurnException, WrongGamePhaseException, NotEnoughResourcesException, CardPositionException, NoNameException
      Let the Player capsule in a PlacedCard connected to the rootCard graph of the Player
      Parameters:
      namePlayer - Player who sent the request
      index - Which card wants to place
      position - In which position of the table the player wants to be place the card
      side - To which side wants the player to place the card
      Returns:
      the id of the card placed
      Throws:
      NoTurnException - if the player is not the current player
      WrongGamePhaseException - if the game is not in the right phase
      NotEnoughResourcesException - if the player doesn't have enough resources
      CardPositionException - if the card can't be placed in the position
      NoNameException - if the player name is not found

    • drawCard

      public int drawCard(String namePlayer, boolean Gold, int CardPosition) throws WrongGamePhaseException, NoTurnException, NoNameException, CardPositionException
      Allows the Player to draw a card from the table or decks (there are 6 different possibilities based on goldOrNot and onTableOrDeck)
      Parameters:
      namePlayer - Player who sent the request
      Gold - If the type of the resourceCard that wants to be drawn is gold or not
      CardPosition - If the card is taken from the table or not: -1 means from deck, 0 and 1 are the position onTable array
      Returns:
      the id of the card drawn
      Throws:
      WrongGamePhaseException - if the game is not in the right phase
      NoTurnException - if the player is not the current player
      NoNameException - if the player name is not found
      CardPositionException - if the card can't be drawn from the position

      public void endGame() throws WrongGamePhaseException
      Represents the last part of the game, in which the points gained from fulfilling the objectives are calculated.
      Throws:
      WrongGamePhaseException - if the game is not in the right phase

      public boolean requirementsSatisfied(Player player, GoldCard goldCard)
      Controls if the resources of a Player are enough for the requirements of a GoldCard
      Parameters:
      player - Player about we want to know if they can place the GoldCard
      goldCard - GoldCard that wants to be placed and has certain requirements
      Returns:
      true if the player has enough resources to place the GoldCard, false otherwise

      Returns:
      The next gold card from the deck.

      Returns:

    • getGameState

      public GameState getGameState()
      Retrieves the current state of the game. This method is used to check the current phase of the game, which can be useful for determining the valid actions that can be performed at any given time.
      Returns:
      The current state of the game as a GameState enum.

    • getCard

      public Integer getCard(boolean gold, int onTableOrDeck)
      Retrieves the card from the table or deck based on the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      gold - Indicates if the card to be retrieved is a gold card. If true, a gold card is retrieved, otherwise a resource card is retrieved.
      onTableOrDeck - Specifies the location of the card. If it's a number between 0 and 1, it refers to the position on the table. If it's -1, the card is drawn from the deck.
      Returns:
      The ID of the retrieved card. If the specified card does not exist, null is returned.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the specified card position does not exist.

    • getObjectiveCard

      public Card getObjectiveCard(int i)
      Retrieves an objective card from the table in the game. This method is used to retrieve an objective card from the table in the game.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the objective card on the table.
      Returns:
      The objective card at the specified index on the table.

    • getObjectiveCardToChoose

      public ObjectiveCard getObjectiveCardToChoose(int i, int j)
      Retrieves an objective card that a player can choose. This method is used to retrieve an objective card from the set of cards that a player can choose from.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the player in the game.
      j - The index of the objective card in the player's set of choosable cards.
      Returns:
      The objective card at the specified indices.

    • getHeadDeck

      public Kingdom getHeadDeck(boolean gold)
      Retrieves the kingdom of the first card in the specified deck. This method is used to peek at the first card in the deck without drawing it. It can be used to plan ahead and make strategic decisions based on the upcoming card.
      Parameters:
      gold - If true, the method checks the gold deck. If false, it checks the resource deck.
      Returns:
      The kingdom of the first card in the specified deck. If the deck is empty, returns null.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified deck is empty.

    • getResourceCard

      public Card getResourceCard(int position)
      Retrieves the resource card at the specified position on the table. This method is used to retrieve a specific resource card from the table in the game. The position is based on the order in which the cards are placed on the table.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the resource card on the table.
      Returns:
      The resource card at the specified position. If the position is invalid, null is returned.

    • getGoldCard

      public Card getGoldCard(int position)
      Retrieves the gold card at the specified position on the table. This method is used to retrieve a specific gold card from the table in the game. The position is based on the order in which the cards are placed on the table.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the gold card on the table.
      Returns:
      The gold card at the specified position. If the position is invalid, null is returned.

    • getStartingCardToPosition

      public StartingCard getStartingCardToPosition(String nickname) throws NoNameException
      Retrieves the starting card assigned to a player. This method is used to retrieve the starting card that has been assigned to a player based on their nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player.
      Returns:
      The starting card assigned to the player.
      Throws:
      NoNameException - If the player with the given nickname does not exist.

    • getTurnType

      public TurnType getTurnType()
      Retrieves the current turn type of the game. This method is used to check the current turn type of the game, which can be useful for determining the valid actions that can be performed at any given time.
      Returns:
      The current turn type of the game as a TurnType enum.

    • calculateEndGamePoints

      public int calculateEndGamePoints(ObjectiveType type, int multiplier, Player player, Kingdom kingdom)
      Calculate the number of points given by an objective card.
      Parameters:
      type - type of the objective card.
      multiplier - multiplier of the objective card.
      player - player who is getting targeted.
      kingdom - kingdom of the objective card.
      Returns:
      number of points to add to the player points

    • getLobby

      public Lobby getLobby()
      Retrieves the lobby of players in the game. This method is used to access the lobby of players in the game, which contains information about all the players currently participating in the game.
      Returns:
      The lobby of players in the game.
